  physical_appearance: This painting is a montage of scenes depicting the surrender of the Japanese. In the top-right there is a portrait of a man in a suit. The top half of the painting features a seated row of Japanese officers in green uniforms
 with one of them signing a document handed by a British officer on the left. The scene below shows a group of military men walking into a court room
 with a small scene of the court trial on the bottom left. There is an inscription at the top
 and a signature and date at the bottom left of the painting.

  subject_terms_4: 

  sgcool_label_text: This painting belongs to a larger collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012)
 who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee
 which date from mid 1990s to early 2000s. \r\n\r\nForce 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.\r\n\r\nThis painting is a rendition of the Japanese surrender at the end of World War II by Tan Chong Tee.  \r\n

metadata.title_text: Unconditional Surrender that Ended World War II
metadata.physical_appearance: This painting is a montage of scenes depicting the surrender of the Japanese. In the top-right there is a portrait of a man in a suit. The top half of the painting features a seated row of Japanese officers in green uniforms, with one of them signing a document handed by a British officer on the left. The scene below shows a group of military men walking into a court room, with a small scene of the court trial on the bottom left. There is an inscription at the top, and a signature and date at the bottom left of the painting.

metadata.subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Painting Chen, Chongzhi, 1916- Great Britain. Army. Force 136 Force 136 (Guerilla movement)
metadata.subject_terms_3: 1942-1945 Japanese occupation Tan, Chong Tee Force 136 (Guerilla movement) Oil painting Surrender of Japan, 1945
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This painting belongs to a larger collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from mid 1990s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.

This painting is a rendition of the Japanese surrender at the end of World War II by Tan Chong Tee.
